p: Therefore, the antimicrobial activities of essential oils of herbs may be correlated with the increase chrysanthemum cut flowers' vase life. These effects have been reported by Serrano et al. (2005), who indicated that the fortification of eugenol, thymol, menthol, and eucalyptol in the storage of sweet cherries significantly reduced the growth of microbial agents. Similarly, Chanjirakul et al. (2008) reported that the use of natural compounds in some products; protects the cell's physical structure against oxidative damage caused by reactive oxygen species by increasing the antioxidant capacity of the products. Hence, cell membranes, which are the main target of reactive oxygen species, are also protected in this way.
